content: Title IX prohibits sex-based discrimination in education programs receiving federal financial assistance, with exceptions for certain institutions regarding admissions. Title IX applies to institutions of vocational education, professional education, and graduate higher education, as well as public institutions of undergraduate higher education, unless they traditionally admit only one sex. This means Title IX does not apply to admissions to nonvocational elementary or secondary schools, or certain institutions of undergraduate higher education, allowing for single-sex schools to exist.
